bibl.title: Bill from the Georgia State Assembly, [19--]

div1.p: This bill is meant to regulate the impounding of water.

div1.head: Bill from the Georgia State Assembly, [19--]
div1.opener:
Copy.
From Ga. State Bl. of Health.
div1.p:
To be entitled an Act to require all Cities, Private Corpora-
tions, Partnerships and all individuals who shall impound water
for any purposes to have the same first approved by the State
Board of Health in relation to the effect on the Public Health.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Geor-
gia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same. That
the State Board of Health shall have general oversight and care of
all impounded waters in relation to the effect of these waters up-
on the health of individuals.

Be it further enacted, that any City, private corporations,
partnerships or individuals who intend to impound any water must
first submit to the State Board of Health for their approval com-
plete plans and specifications of the project, giving detailed
information as to areas to be flooded, showing the high and the
low water line and all other data as to the amount of clearing
and grubbing intended.

Be it further enacted that on the receipt of a request for
approval, the Commissioner of Health shall cause a detailed sur-
vey to be made of the intended project and the relation that this
impounded water might have on the health of any persons living
within one mile of the high water line when the impounded reser-
voir is full.

Be it further enacted that if, in the judgment of the
State Board of Health, the same is dangerous to the health of
the people from a malaria standpoint, the State Board of Health
may require any modifications to the said plans which will help
to protect any individual living up to one mile from the high
water line, when the impounded reservoir is full, from the
dangers of malaria.

Be it further enacted that no water shall be impounded
unless the shore line is cleared of such shrubbery, trees,
grasses, moss or other vegetation, as, in the opinion of the
State Board of Health, is necessary or expedient between the
low and high water marks, and after the impounded reservoir
is completed, due care and inspection must be kept by the City,
Private Corporations, Partnerships or Individuals to see that
the above edge is kept clear at all times from any growths or
floating debris that might interfere with the proper action of
mosquito destroying fish.

Be it further enacted that any person or persons violating
the provisions of this Act shall be deemed guilty of a misde-
meanor and, on conviction, shall be punished as prescribed in
section 1065 of Park's Annotated Penal Code.

Be it further enacted that all laws and parts of laws in
conflict herewith are hereby repealed.
